data.quote: I think, in our darkest moments, you have to find the humor, and you have to find the lightness.

data.quote: Texas humor and Southern humor are pretty similar.
data.author: Daniel Woodrell

data.quote: I quite like dark humor.

data.quote: Religious humor is not really my area, so I probably wouldn't do anything about that, or politics or something.

data.quote: I tend to deal with most issues with humor... always have and always will.

data.quote: Part of my humor is the fact that I love coming out of left field. I don't want people to expect what is going to happen next.

data.author: George Herbert

data.quote: I like doing comedy, I like doing drama. Naturally I like to do, I like doing dramas, I like conflict, and when I do a comedy, you know, I've found that, like, romantic comedy is the trickiest one, because often it's neither: it's not romantic and it's not funny. So, like, I like a comedy that's biting. It's biting humor or really quirky humor.

data.quote: Yes, I have a good sense of humor to sort of last a long time in show business, and I think to be able to find comedic value in who you are and the people that you work is always a good thing.

data.quote: Well, darkness with humor... I'm not an extremely suicidal or sad person.

data.quote: The woman who runs the Pennsylvania Innocence Project told me that there's a man she's been trying to get out of prison for 26 years. data.quote: You probably found 'How to Survive a Robot Uprising' in the humor section. Let's just hope that is where it belongs.

data.quote: I'm a comedian, and I have my share of anxiety and depression; so do most of my friends. My humor tends to lie in the juxtaposition of extreme lightness - I'm a huge musical-theater fan - and extreme darkness. And so I really like playing with those because that's how I feel.

data.quote: I'm not sure. But that bless-his/her-heart kind of melancholic humor is among my favorite things in the world. data.quote: I'm looking at some comedic horror films because I have often been accused of being too dark. I'm not dark, not compared with 'Saw' or anything like that. So I'm looking at live-action horror films, but not slasher ones - ones that have humor and maybe some social satire.

data.quote: It's amazing how these little guys can say things that a mortal human could never get away with. There's some sort of unspoken license... when outlandish things come out of an inanimate object, somehow it equals humor.

data.quote: I've worked a lot in comedy. As much as I love playing dramatic roles, it's always nice to be able to have some humor around when working.
data.author: Tom Ellis

data.quote: Lucifer has a sense of fun about life he just likes to play with people. But the sense of humor of the show is what makes the show entertaining as opposed to dark.
data.author: Tom Ellis

data.quote: There's some sort of unspoken license... when outlandish things come out of an inanimate object, somehow it equals humor.
data.author: Jeff Dunham

data.quote: It is characteristic of all deep human problems that they are not to be approached without some humor and some bewilderment.
data.author: Freeman Dyson

data.quote: Reilly Brown is a master of balancing action, humor, and extreme violence, and his character designs for some of the alien races and technology that we encounter is just amazing.

data.quote: I can't be as open on national television as I can when I'm having dinner with friends. But that doesn't mean the type of person I am is different. My values, my dislikes, my sense of humor are the same.

data.quote: Be fun! I don't like homes or rooms that don't have a sense of humor or have some sense of whimsy or a personality. Your home should reflect who you are, and what you love. data.author: Bryan Batt

data.quote: My parents and my sister died... very close together, and after that, I lost quite a bit of my sense of humor. Most of it I think has kind of come back, but I know there was a time when I didn't think things were funny anymore. I kind of think they're funny again.

data.quote: God has a most wicked sense of humor.
data.author: Maureen O'Hara

data.quote: Bathroom humor, fart, and poo poo humor in movies gets a laugh. It's a pretty easy audience, and that's been around for ages.
data.author: Selma Blair

data.quote: I learned early in my career to not let myself get in the way of humor but, instead, find what is great in a talented person.
data.author: Tamra Davis

data.quote: I always had to genuinely like the actors I worked with and use my enthusiasm and vision to give them confidence to push their creativity and their humor.
data.author: Tamra Davis

data.quote: My humor tends to be a little more edgy than is appropriate for 'Twilight,' although I got some in there. That was fun! There's just a tonal difference. For me, storytelling is storytelling. But, I do like writing for grown ups.

data.quote: Don't wish me happiness - I don't expect to be happy it's gotten beyond that, somehow. Wish me courage and strength and a sense of humor - I will need them all.

data.quote: The way humor's usually used in horror, it's as a pressure-release valve; without it, the drama would escalate out of all control almost immediately.

data.quote: Whatever else an American believes or disbelieves about himself, he is absolutely sure he has a sense of humor.

data.quote: When you meet someone new who instantly gets you, your sense of humor and your attitudes and your worldview, even if theirs are different - and you get them in return. You both talk and talk and agree and laugh and nod and yes, yes, of course you should get another round of drinks.

data.quote: You can't be funny if you don't have good material.
data.author: Matt LeBlanc

data.quote: Both conservatives and liberals watch 'Parks and Recreation,' and they each think the show is for them, which is really cool. 'SNL' was totally different. It was exciting because everyone was paying attention. Political humor works when people know what you're talking about.

data.quote: Humor is perhaps a sense of intellectual perspective: an awareness that some things are really important, others not; and that the two kinds are most oddly jumbled in everyday affairs.
data.author: Christopher Morley

data.quote: There are so many things to talk about between black people, Hispanic people, white people, gay people, men, women, it's all based on fear. We all have fears, this thing that stops us from embracing as we are one. We are never going to be one. People are messed up, but humor lets us see how ignorant we can be.
data.author: Marlon Wayans

data.quote: You learn timing on the road. You learn structure and how to read an audience. You learn so much about the business of laughter that you can't learn on a set, because it's all on you. Sometimes you bomb, and you know not to tell that joke again... You just hope people find the humor in the awkwardness.
data.author: Marlon Wayans

data.quote: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.
data.author: Sun Tzu

data.quote: The art of war teaches us to rely not on the likelihood of the enemy's not coming, but on our own readiness to receive him; not on the chance of his not attacking, but rather on the fact that we have made our position unassailable.
data.author: Sun Tzu

data.quote: Mankind must put an end to war before war puts an end to mankind.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: No event in American history is more misunderstood than the Vietnam War. It was misreported then, and it is misremembered now.
data.author: Richard M. Nixon

data.quote: Older men declare war. But it is the youth that must fight and die.
data.author: Herbert Hoover

data.quote: The Cold War isn't thawing; it is burning with a deadly heat. Communism isn't sleeping; it is, as always, plotting, scheming, working, fighting.

data.quote: Thus, what is of supreme importance in war is to attack the enemy's strategy.
data.author: Sun Tzu

data.quote: During the time men live without a common power to keep them all in awe, they are in that conditions called war; and such a war, as if of every man, against every man.
data.author: Thomas Hobbes

data.quote: It was my duty to shoot the enemy, and I don't regret it. My regrets are for the people I couldn't save: Marines, soldiers, buddies. I'm not naive, and I don't romanticize war. data.author: Chris Kyle

data.quote: European nations began World War I with a glamorous vision of war, only to be psychologically shattered by the realities of the trenches. The experience changed the way people referred to the glamour of battle; they treated it no longer as a positive quality but as a dangerous illusion.

data.quote: The condition of man... is a condition of war of everyone against everyone.
data.author: Thomas Hobbes

data.quote: In an era in which war and terrorism - at home and abroad - are often based on racial, religious and ethnic differences, rediscovering the wisdom of love and compassion may help us increase our survival at a time when an increasingly divided country and world so badly need it.
data.author: Dean Ornish

data.quote: I joined the army on my seventeenth birthday, full of the romance of war after having read a lot of World War I British poetry and having seen a lot of post-World War II films. I thought the romantic presentations of war influenced my joining and my presentation of war to my younger siblings.
data.author: Walter Dean Myers

data.quote: We shall defend our island, whatever the cost may be, we shall fight on the beaches, we shall fight on the landing grounds, we shall fight in the fields and in the streets, we shall fight in the hills; we shall never surrender.

data.quote: Bad things do happen in the world, like war, natural disasters, disease. But out of those situations always arise stories of ordinary people doing extraordinary things.
data.author: Daryn Kagan

data.quote: Brave men rejoice in adversity, just as brave soldiers triumph in war.
data.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: I saw courage both in the Vietnam War and in the struggle to stop it. I learned that patriotism includes protest, not just military service.
data.author: John F. Kerry

data.quote: We owe our World War II veterans - and all our veterans - a debt we can never fully repay.

data.quote: The atomic bomb made the prospect of future war unendurable. It has led us up those last few steps to the mountain pass and beyond there is a different country.
data.author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

data.quote: Quickness is the essence of the war.
data.author: Sun Tzu

data.quote: I am tired and sick of war. Its glory is all moonshine. It is only those who have neither fired a shot nor heard the shrieks and groans of the wounded who cry aloud for blood, for vengeance, for desolation. War is hell.

data.quote: The lesson of the Cold War is that against nuclear weapons, only nuclear weapons can hold the peace.
data.author: Chung Mong-joon

data.quote: The more you sweat in peace, the less you bleed in war.

data.quote: The art of war is simple enough. Find out where your enemy is. Get at him as soon as you can. Strike him as hard as you can, and keep moving on.

data.quote: What a cruel thing war is... to fill our hearts with hatred instead of love for our neighbors.
data.author: Robert E. Lee

data.quote: My father was very disappointed by war and fighting. And he thought language could help us out of cycles of revenge and animosity. He was always very clear to underscore the fact that Jewish people and Arab people were brother and sister.
data.author: Naomi Shihab Nye

data.quote: There is no avoiding war it can only be postponed to the advantage of others.
data.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

data.quote: World War I was not inevitable, as many historians say. It could have been avoided, and it was a diplomatically botched negotiation.

data.quote: Be at war with your vices, at peace with your neighbors, and let every new year find you a better man.

data.quote: Our Generation has had no Great war, no Great Depression. Our war is spiritual. Our depression is our lives.

data.quote: Not all moral issues have the same moral weight as abortion and euthanasia. There may be legitimate diversity of opinion even among Catholics about waging war and applying the death penalty, but not... with regard to abortion and euthanasia.

data.quote: My first wish is to see this plague of mankind, war, banished from the earth.

data.quote: Communism has never come to power in a country that was not disrupted by war or corruption, or both.

data.quote: We should keep on going along the path of globalization. Globalization is good... when trade stops, war comes.

data.quote: Ten soldiers wisely led will beat a hundred without a head.

data.quote: The great questions of the day will not be settled by means of speeches and majority decisions but by iron and blood.
data.author: Otto von Bismarck

data.quote: A quality education grants us the ability to fight the war on ignorance and poverty.

data.quote: There are two problems for our species' survival - nuclear war and environmental catastrophe - and we're hurtling towards them. Knowingly.

data.quote: I had a very strong feeling about the Vietnam War, and I had a strong feeling about participating in it. data.quote: I'm a Canadian. Outside Canada I carry the flag. Canadian nationalism isn't as insidious as American nationalism, though. It's good natured. It's all about maple syrup, not war.

data.quote: As a soldier, I survived World War I when most of my comrades did not.
data.author: Lester B. Pearson

data.quote: Great is the guilt of an unnecessary war.
data.author: John Adams

data.quote: The United Nations' founders understood that decisions affecting war and peace should happen only by consensus, and with America's consent, the veto by Security Council permanent members was enshrined in the United Nations Charter. data.author: Vladimir Putin

data.quote: I covered the Vietnam War. I remember the lies that were told, the lives that were lost - and the shock when, twenty years after the war ended, former Defense Secretary Robert S. McNamara admitted he knew it was a mistake all along.

data.quote: This union has been divided in like a civil war - brother against brother - sister against sister. And I'm pulling it together. data.quote: Serious sport has nothing to do with fair play. It is bound up with hatred, jealousy, boastfulness, disregard of all rules and sadistic pleasure in witnessing violence. In other words, it is war minus the shooting.

data.quote: Something is wanting, and something must be done, or we shall be involved in all the horror of failure, and civil war without a prospect of its termination.

data.quote: We make war that we may live in peace.

data.quote: We live in an age, in an era where there is so much negativity, there is so much violence in the world, there is so much unrest and people are at war, that I wanted to promote the word love and red signifies love.

data.quote: War is cruelty. There is no use trying to reform it. The crueler it is, the sooner it will be over.

data.quote: World War II is the greatest drama in human history, the biggest war ever and a true battle of good and evil. I imagine writers will continue to get stories from it, and readers will continue to love them, for many more years.

data.quote: There is no hunting like the hunting of man, and those who have hunted armed men long enough and liked it, never care for anything else thereafter.

data.quote: An asteroid or a supervolcano could certainly destroy us, but we also face risks the dinosaurs never saw: An engineered virus, nuclear war, inadvertent creation of a micro black hole, or some as-yet-unknown technology could spell the end of us.

data.quote: Marriage is an adventure, like going to war.

data.quote: The problems we face now - poverty and violence at home, war and destruction abroad - will last only as long as we continue relying on the same politicians who created them in the first place.

data.quote: You can no more win a war than you can win an earthquake.

data.quote: Terrorism has become the systematic weapon of a war that knows no borders or seldom has a face.

data.quote: What gunpowder did for war the printing press has done for the mind.

data.quote: I have not yet begun to fight!

data.quote: Every war when it comes, or before it comes, is represented not as a war but as an act of self-defense against a homicidal maniac.

data.quote: When I see the Confederate flag, I see the attempt to raise an empire in slavery. It really, really is that simple. I don't understand how anybody with any sort of education on the Civil War can see anything else.

data.quote: For me, true beauty has nothing to do with wrinkles and everything to do with the fact that my maternal grandmother raised five children just after the war and remained a fighter throughout her life. data.quote: Morality binds people into groups. It gives us tribalism, it gives us genocide, war, and politics. But it also gives us heroism, altruism, and sainthood.

data.quote: So I would say God hates war, but God loves every soldier.

data.quote: In war, events of importance are the result of trivial causes.

data.quote: We have but one flag, one country; let us stand together. We may differ in color, but not in sentiment. Many things have been said about me which are wrong, and which white and black persons here, who stood by me through the war, can contradict.

data.quote: Life on Earth is at the ever-increasing risk of being wiped out by a disaster, such as sudden global nuclear war, a genetically engineered virus or other dangers we have not yet thought of.

data.quote: The art of war is of vital importance to the state. It is a matter of life and death, a road either to safety or to ruin. Hence it is a subject of inquiry which can on no account be neglected.

data.quote: The negative effects of combat were nightmares, and I'd get jumpy around certain noises and stuff, but you'd have that after a car accident or a bad divorce. Life's filled with trauma. data.quote: In war, whichever side may call itself the victor, there are no winners, but all are losers.

data.quote: From the neck up is where you win or lose the battle. It's the art of war. You have to lock yourself in and strategise your mindset. That's why boxers go to training camps: to shut down the noise and really zone in.

data.quote: People never lie so much as after a hunt, during a war or before an election.

data.quote: I find capitalism repugnant. It is filthy, it is gross, it is alienating... because it causes war, hypocrisy and competition.

data.quote: The world knows that America will never start a war. This generation of Americans has had enough of war and hate... we want to build a world of peace where the weak are secure and the strong are just.

data.quote: The philosophy of protectionism is a philosophy of war.

data.quote: God is day and night, winter and summer, war and peace, surfeit and hunger.

data.quote: War - An act of violence whose object is to constrain the enemy, to accomplish our will.

data.quote: War is the greatest plague that can afflict humanity, it destroys religion, it destroys states, it destroys families. Any scourge is preferable to it.

data.quote: The war on drugs is a war against the communities.

data.quote: There has never been a protracted war from which a country has benefited.

data.quote: I have never advocated war except as a means of peace.

data.quote: Secret operations are essential in war upon them the army relies to make its every move.

data.quote: I know that war and mayhem run in our blood. I refuse to believe that they must dominate our lives. data.quote: It is good that war is so horrible, or we might grow to like it.

data.quote: It just seems to me that the world's kind of a mess, and the more messy it gets, the more interested I am in escapist fare. I'm eager to get away from them.

data.quote: World War II ended the Great Depression with one of the great public-private industrial collaborations in the history of man.
data.author: Jon Meacham

data.quote: In time of war the laws are silent.

data.quote: Ever since World War I, superior force is no longer measured in terms of men or horses, but in the means to wreak destruction.

data.quote: A pint of sweat, saves a gallon of blood.

data.quote: If we are to teach real peace in this world, and if we are to carry on a real war against war, we shall have to begin with the children.

data.quote: We've persevered because of a belief we share with the Iraqi people - a belief that out of the ashes of war, a new beginning could be born in this cradle of civilization. data.quote: No one ever said that fighting the war against terrorism and defending our homeland would be easy. So let's support our troops, law enforcement workers, and our mission to keep our nation and our children safe in the days and years to come.

data.quote: After two world wars, the collapse of fascism, nazism, communism and colonialism and the end of the cold war, humanity has entered a new phase of its history.

data.quote: The critical importance of honest journalism and a free flowing, respectful national conversation needs to be had in our country. But it is being buried as collateral damage in a war whose battles include political correctness and ideological orthodoxy.

data.quote: The Founders who crafted our Constitution and Bill of Rights were careful to draft a Constitution of limited powers - one that would protect Americans' liberty at all times - both in war, and in peace.

data.quote: Only the dead have seen the end of the war.

data.quote: War is an ugly thing, but not the ugliest of things. The decayed and degraded state of moral and patriotic feeling which thinks that nothing is worth war is much worse.

data.quote: One of the good things about the way the Gulf War ended in 1991 is, you'd see the Vietnam veterans marching with the Gulf War veterans.

data.quote: There is so much that must be done in a civilized barbarism like war.

data.quote: The best weapon against an enemy is another enemy.

data.quote: Ours is a world of nuclear giants and ethical infants. We know more about war that we know about peace, more about killing that we know about living.

data.quote: Peace has its victories no less than war, but it doesn't have as many monuments to unveil.

data.quote: With the end of the cold war, all the 'isms' of the 20th century - Fascism, Nazism, Communism and the evil of apartheid-ism - have failed. Except one. Only democracy has shown itself true the help of all mankind.

data.quote: In 1953, after the armistice ending the Korean War, South Korea lay in ruins. President Eisenhower was eager to put an end to hostilities that had left his predecessor deeply unpopular, and the war ended in an uneasy stalemate.
data.author: Noah Feldman

data.quote: The government has a history of not treating people fairly, from the internment of Japanese Americans in World War II to African-Americans in the Civil Rights era.
data.author: Rand Paul

data.quote: The first and most imperative necessity in war is money, for money means everything else - men, guns, ammunition.
data.author: Ida Tarbell

data.quote: Fortune, which has a great deal of power in other matters but especially in war, can bring about great changes in a situation through very slight forces.
data.author: Julius Caesar

data.quote: It is not enough to say we must not wage war. It is necessary to love peace and sacrifice for it.
data.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

data.quote: We were emerging from the period of war, of uniforms, of women-soldiers built like boxers. I drew women-flowers, soft shoulders, fine waists like liana and wide skirts like corolla.
data.author: Christian Dior

data.quote: I worked night and day for twelve years to prevent the war, but I could not. The North was mad and blind, would not let us govern ourselves, and so the war came.

data.quote: Love has its place, as does hate. Peace has its place, as does war. Mercy has its place, as do cruelty and revenge.

data.quote: Nullification means insurrection and war and the other states have a right to put it down.

data.quote: When all the world is overcharged with inhabitants, then the last remedy of all is war, which provideth for every man, by victory or death.
data.author: Thomas Hobbes

data.quote: There's something brave and touching about game girls of all ages keeping themselves smart in hard times - one thinks of those wonderful women during World War II drawing stocking seams in eyebrow pencil up the back of legs stained with gravy browning because nylons were so hard to get hold of.

data.author: Mo Rocca

data.quote: You ask me if I will not be glad when the last battle is fought, so far as the country is concerned I, of course, must wish for peace, and will be glad when the war is ended, but if I answer for myself alone, I must say that I shall regret to see the war end.
data.author: George Armstrong Custer

data.quote: But to the fighting soldier that phase of the war is behind. It was left behind after his first battle. His blood is up. He is fighting for his life, and killing now for him is as much a profession as writing is for me.
data.author: Ernie Pyle

data.quote: Oceania was at war with Eurasia therefore Oceania had always been at war with Eurasia.
data.author: George Orwell

data.quote: We are muddled into war.
data.author: David Lloyd George

data.quote: The Berlin Wall wasn't the only barrier to fall after the collapse of the Soviet Union and the end of the Cold War. Traditional barriers to the flow of money, trade, people and ideas also fell.
data.author: Fareed Zakaria

data.quote: I was a surf bum wannabe. I left home at age 17 and moved to Southern California to try to take up surfing as a vocation, but this was in 1964, and there was this nasty little thing called the Vietnam War. As a result, I got drafted.
data.author: Craig Venter
